title: Soulcial
description:
I’m Krizia Cruz and this is Soulcial Podcast. 

For as long as I can remember, I’ve always been a genuinely curious person. Small talk? Not my thing. I want to know what makes you tick. In fact, this passion pushed me to become a journalist. Throughout the years, I’ve interviewed hundreds of individuals and I’ve asked questions that made me reflect on my own life. Questions that inspired me to become a better version of myself, someone I can be proud of.

This series is all about asking trailblazers and people I admire the questions we all want to hear. I’ll take you through open conversations that will inspire you to do better and be better. 

I’m here to bring attention to these leaders and highlight just how they have successfully and authentically aligned their passion, talents and personality. 

I want YOU to feel empowered. 
I want YOU to have tangible techniques and takeaways so that you can develop more meaningful dialogues and relationships. Not just with yourself, but also those around you. 

Now let's do this and let’s add soul to your social.

What’s Tan Cha? In Chinese culture, it’s drinking tea. Hosted by two natives of Canton, internationals, women of color, Michelle and Shuran explore cultural differences and tackle identity challenges. With our respective backgrounds in Business Intelligence Analytics and Journalism, we engage in inspiring conversations about our experiences in the United States and how people from East Asia navigate their paths in another culture. We discuss how the differences help shape our daily lives - from school to job, and everything in between.

How do they spend their money? How did they make it? Join me, Connor Lewis, as I break down the stories behind the world's elite and learn how we can apply their pasts to our future.

title: Leadership is Lonely
description: We are leaders in a healthcare organization. Before COVID, our team which consists of RN’s CNA’s and psychosocial supports are field based healthcare workers and would pop in and out of the office during the day. After COVID, in an effort to reduce the spread, our doors have been closed to field staff, corporate leadership has been grounded from traveling to our offices and we needed a way to keep everyone motivated, engaged and connected. We have always started our day with a 15 minute morning team call, its primary purpose was to inform the team of any patient needs. After COVID, we needed to rethink how we have always done things and reinvent the utility of the morning call. We emerged with a call that provided motivation, support, encouragement, critical COVID updates, patient need updates, employee and team engagement, and strong leadership to help everyone see their way through this Global Crisis. What we happened upon was magic! For a team that pretty much turned over 75% in the early months of COVID, mainly due to personal circumstances, we needed to form and norm a team virtually. We would say we not only accomplished that goal, but THRIVED into one of the best, most cohesive teams we have ever been a part of. This podcast is about how we do it...

title: AIAA Los Angeles - Las Vegas Section Podcast
description:
AIAA is non-profit 501(c)3 professional organization promoting aerospace. Our purpose is to ignite and celebrate aerospace ingenuity and collaboration, and its importance to our way of life. Our promise is to be your vital lifelong link to the aerospace community and a champion for its achievements.

One Remarkable Fact Says It All: Since 1963, members from a single professional society have achieved virtually every milestone in modern American flight. That society is the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics. With nearly 30,000 individual members from 91 countries, and 95 corporate members, AIAA is the world’s largest technical society dedicated to the global aerospace profession. Created in 1963 by the merger of the two great aerospace societies of the day, the American Rocket Society (founded in 1930 as the American Interplanetary Society), and the Institute of the Aerospace Sciences (established in 1933 as the Institute of the Aeronautical Sciences), AIAA carries forth a proud tradition of more than 80 years of aerospace leadership.

The Los Angeles – Las Vegas Section is a community of 7000+ Aerospace Professionals, providing services to the communities from Los Angeles to Las Vegas, including San Bernardino and Riverside. Southern California and Las Vegas area has lots of aerospace organizations add activities, and is the center of American aerospace.

title: The Equalizer Project Podcast
description:
How do we fix historic inequities that continue to plague people of color… particularly in Corporate America?  It is clear that our citizens are no longer comfortable with the traditional approaches to addressing systemic challenges – i.e. ones that contain the “right language and practices” but are mostly symbolic and ultimately, yield slow, and often, insignificant change. 

And so, this podcast, The Equalizer Project was born. Through conversations with leaders who can share rich, complex, and powerful experiences of life in the corporate world, I hope to bring awareness, to heal, to inspire and to leave the audience with hope and a solution, yes, a solution! It is part of my calling or personal mission – to change lives and to leave others better off.

This is the work of The Equalizer Project.

title: Full STEAM Ahead
description:
The purpose of Full STEAM Ahead is to provide a platform for individuals who are, currently pursuing, or planning to pursue a career in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM). While the discussion and promotion of STEM fields is the main focus of the show, Art plays a key role as well. The Art portion of the show discusses various manners and how it relates to STEM. Full STEAM Ahead promotes careers in the STEAM field and serves as an outlet for professionals looking for inspirational interviews.

The goal of the podcast is to uplift African Americans and people of color in the fields listed above. While tons of money each year are donated to STEAM fields by companies, celebrities, athletes, influencers, etc., the world only gets to see small clips of these interactions. On one end of the spectrum, there are several radio shows and podcasts that focus on at least one, if not all of the following: pop culture, hip-hop culture, politics, or sports. Completely opposite of this, there are podcasts and radio shows that discuss: academia, heavily technical topics, and STEM. Full STEAM Ahead aims to have a little bit of both.

Starring James aka J Linz, Allante aka LL, Brill, Diggs, Dr. Shar and Taylor D. The show consists of three segments and a main topic or interview. Segments include LITT (Lessons In The Trap), Nature Vs. Nurture and Blowing Off Some STEAM. Dive in to see what we’re all about!

title: Executive Career Upgrades
description:
Welcome to the Executive Career Upgrades Podcast with your hosts, Tim and Kristina Madden. Here we share tactics and strategies each week to help business professionals targeting multiple 6 Figures navigate this current job market so that they can land the job they deserve! Whether you need help with your branding, getting on more interviews, converting interviews to offers, maximizing your compensation, or mindset clarity, this podcast is for you! Tim Madden is the Founder of Executive Career Upgrades and is a Veteran Headhunter who has led teams that have sold and fulfilled on over 50 million dollars in Staffing and Recruitment services since 2013 and has helped place over 6,000 business professionals. Prior to that, he was one of the top recruiters for the military and went on to become an Army Field Artillery Officer. He has seen tens of thousands of resumes (probably more) and interacted with CEOs and Senior Executives at some of the top companies in the world. And, he is a frequent contributor to Entrepreneur.com, Fast Company, Forbes, & Newsweek and sits on the council of various organizations.

Your co-host, Kristina Madden, co-founder and Chief People Officer of Executive Career Upgrades, is a Mindset Expert who has worked with top Executives to develop their mindset, helping them to reframe their state of mind to achieve success and reach their true potential. Kristina has consulted for some of the fastest-growing companies on the Inc. 500 list.

Resumes almost never clearly describe someone’s own “true skills and achievements,” most of the time, hiring managers want to focus on specific bullet points in a job description. This isn’t something that is new; this is a challenge candidates and hiring managers have had going on for years. Also, most people are confused in their career. They don’t know what to target, they don’t know how to build a clear impactful message, and most of the time settle for mediocrity which leads to poor job performance, low pay, and unfulfillment. Not only do Tim and Kristina Madden attract high-quality candidates for companies, but they are also passionate about helping high achievers land that next multiple 6-figure job, which most of the time is less about tactics and more about mindset and confidence.

Our guest are knowledgeable sharing years of Cultivation experience throughout a multitude of trades within the Cannabis Industry.

description: I am Ana Maria a wife, mother, furniture and interior designer sharing design trends, tips & tricks. Follow me to learn more about this creative designer world. Be inspired!

title: CDS Insight
description: With a long-standing vision to ‘Bridge Perspectives and Opportunities’, CDS Insight Series provides a vibrant platform to boost intellectual conversations among students, professionals, and entrepreneurs.  Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information.

title: The Aesthetic Mentor Podcast
description:
At Aesthetic Mentor, our mission is to educate medical professionals in the art and skill of non-surgical injectables, lasers, devices and technology. Our classes are taught by a Board Certified Plastic Surgeon Dr. Joseph A. Russo and his team of highly qualified training staff.

You get an unprecedented amount of hands-on experience that cannot be matched by any other training facility. The Student-to-teacher ratio is never more than 2-1 and in some cases is 1-1. Our class sizes are limited so each student receives individualized attention.

To know more about our classes, please visit our website  https://www.theaestheticmentor.com

title: Under The Hood with Dr. Sunshine
description: Welcome everyone to a brand new space for aspiring, current, or retired STEM students and professionals. This is also a space for friends and family of STEM people where you can hear first hand accounts of the behind the scenes experiences of those you care for who have dedicated their working lives to careers in STEM.

title: Actually Like
description: In an attempt to share more empathy in the world, I interview people of different stories. People who know what it is actually like doing or being something so that you can relate and empathize with something you might have never thought of before. Anything from relationships to college majors, I got you covered so sit back, relax, and find out what it’s actually like.

title: School of PE Podcast
description: We are so excited to offer our latest educational resource: the School of PE Podcast. Several times a month, we will be releasing a variety of episodes featuring hot topics in engineering along with interviews with School of PE instructors, subject matter experts, and other special guests. Hosted by our Associate Vice President Chris Miller, these podcasts are designed to deliver interesting and informative content you can listen to or watch anywhere, anytime. Tune in regularly so you don’t miss any updates or new content!

title: FM con Eleane y Oscar
description:
Femme Modele (FM) es una academia de modelos que nace en 2006 en San Luis Potosí, Mexico.  Fundada por Eleane Eguia, ex modelo, ganadora del certamen Nuestra Belleza SLP y conductora de Televisión para Mexicanal, ahora reside en Sydney, Australia. Oscar Lopez fue modelo, ganador del Male top model, conductor de television y reside en San Luis Potosí, Mexico. 
Juntos están promoviendo los cursos de modelos y talentos para varias plataformas. Queremos ayudar a estudiantes de modelaje y conducción a  desarrollar su talento en los medios o simplemente para desarrollo personal.
Más información;
https://linktr.ee/Femme_Modele

title: The Monarch Impact
description:
The Monarch Impact is a monthly podcast highlighting the accomplishments of the outstanding Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School Alumnae.  Each episode delves into the achievements of our distinguished Monarchs (and Mustangs!) after they’ve taken flight and left our red and gold corridors. Tune in to listen to how our graduates are forging their futures and making a positive impact. 

The Monarch Impact’s mission is to inspire and empower our alumnae, students, and the Gwynedd community by sharing stories from our graduates. This student produced podcast fosters a connection between past, present, and future Mercy girls. 

The views and opinions expressed here are those of the speakers and do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School, the Sisters of Mercy, or any related affiliate.

title: Whole Creations
description: A faith-based organization that strives to let people with Special Needs know that they were CREATED to LIVE WHOLE, ABLE, AND CAPABLE to accomplish anything they put their hearts to. Also assisting workers in the special needs field. Empowering parents to be their best for their loved ones sake.

title: The Social Guys
description: The Social Guys Podcast is a fun and easy listening podcast that revolves around daily life, talking to people in many different career paths and their journeys, as well as some fun very non important issues, with a mild mix of sports and current events!

title: Conversations with the Creators - St. John's University
description: Innovators who are conceiving the coolest, hottest, most provocative ideas in marketing, media, PR and tech. Hosted by Professor Neil Feinstein, Associate Professor of Advertising Communication, St. John's University. Sponsored by the M.S. in Integrated Advertising Communications

title: Yachaq Warmi
description:
El Yachaq Warmi podcast es un espacio que busca celebrar a latinas en ciencia y donde ellas podrán compartir sus conocimientos y experiencias con la comunidad.

Web: https://www.yachaqwarmi.org/
Presentado por Paola Moreno-Roman, Ph.D.

title: TABANKA TV
description:
A Tabanka é uma plataforma pulsante, com um olhar contemporâneo sob histórias originais africanas.  
Realizamos, documentamos e compartilhamos conteúdo narrado por um elenco de sonhadores, através da produção de conteúdo audiovisual.

Temos como propósito reunir gerações distintas num só espaço digital, criando conteúdo baseado nas nossas vivências.

Somos veículo. Somos movimento. Somos celebração. Somos tabanka. Juntos somos ação.
author_name: Alfredo Costa, Ana Cardoso , Paula Moreira

title: The Empire Building Podcast
description:
Talking all things business, career and empire building.

By Candice Lott and Charlotte Le Pore

description: Ciao a tutti! In questa piattaforma i giovani del Leo Club Valdelsa Fiorentina Unitas presentano il Talk-In Leo! Un podcast accessibile a tutti!

title: Talentnet Podcast
description:
Official Talentnet Corporation Podcast Channel.
Being one of the first local HR companies laying the foundations for Vietnam’s fledgling HR industry, Talentnet was officially established at the end of 2007 from the HR Services team of PricewaterhouseCoopers. Since then, Talentnet has grown significantly to become a well-respected and professional strategic human resources consulting firm.

title: Rose Friday
description: Creative conversations with exciting brands over a glass of Rosé. Our weekly conversations are continuing each week on Instagram live at 4pm with more guests and more Rosé.

title: A Sit Down With Sellinger
description:
Sit Down with Sellinger and learn key insights into the fascinating fields of management and international business!  Gain an inside edge on your future job as business professionals share their career secrets. Listen to the stories of international business managers, who were once in your shoes, and discover what it takes to succeed in the global economy. Delve deeper into industry operations while being led on virtual company visits. 
Take a seat and explore the world of business and more with Sellinger!

title: Where Are They Now?
description: Hosted by Gemma Schneider at Harvard Radio Broadcasting (WHRB), this 6-part series untangles the insights and experiences of Harvard alumni who have made an impact in their respective domains – from journalism to entrepreneurship to show business.

title: The Mailroom
description: Hear from the unheard voices of Hollywood with "The Mailroom." Each week welcomes a different up-and-coming entertainment industry professional to talk about their current role, experiences breaking into the industry, and future aspirations. New episodes every Monday!

title: Aqui na Austrália Podcast
description: Austrália do nosso ponto de vista!

title: Sifu Kris Soundtrack
description:
Kristina Leong is a successful realtor with 12 yrs experience in the industry. Begin as a realtor newbie into now award winner entrepreneur and an agency branch director. 

She is also an awarded real estate coach that has transformed multiple people life through real estate. She will be sharing all her skills and experiences through this podcast

title: Stiftelsen VI
description:
Stiftelsen VI jobber for å gi personer med nedsatt funksjonsevne like muligheter til et fullverdig liv. VI skal bidra til at flere mennesker med funksjonsnedsettelse opplever høyere livskvalitet, forbedret helse, økt mestringstro og mer sosial kontakt.

Gjennom denne podcasten ønsker vi å belyse disse tingene og synliggjøre hvilke muligheter som finnes der ute. Vi kommer til å ha spennende gjester i studio i hver episode.

title: American Storyteller
description: Everyone has a story. Put in your earbuds and spend some time walking in someone else's shoes. Topical, positive, and heartfelt. NEW EPISODES are coming in 2023!

title: VBN - Veterans Broadcast Network
description:
VBN is a radio/podcast network that delivers news, information, and support to Veterans and their dependents.
There are three different shows with three different focuses:

1) Veterans Radio Hour - The military past, present, and future. General Grange discusses the military in todays geopolitical world.

2) Wounded But Not Broken - Host Patrick Scrogin - The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have. Patricks show is about stories of conquering hardships and inspiring others to become the best version of themselves.

3) Role Call - Host Kenney DeCamp - What role did you play in the Military?   Soldiers from every service talk about their jobs in the service.  This show is great for recruitment tool informing anyone interested learning about all the different jobs within the Military.

title: Just Doing Life
description: Growing up in an age filled with highlight reels, ultra-famous 15 year olds, and billionaire Tik Tok stars, it can be easy to feel like you're behind on the path to success. That ~ internal disappointment and fear that you have no clue what you're doing with your life~... I guarantee you we've all been there. Because I know how hard it can be to shake that feeling, I'm here to remind you that everyone's journey looks different. Each week I will be diving into deep conversation with great, unique individuals who share their wild life journeys and the path that's gotten them to where they are today. Exposing the good, the bad, and the ugly; I'm here to remind you that there is no rule book, we are all just doing life :)

title: Mind Your Business Talk Series
description: Mind Your Business Talk Series is here! We are geared to discuss topics that will improve the overall foundation of small businesses. #talksoon

title: Equine Alchemy's Horse Wisdom in Life and Coaching!
description: Lisa Murrell, founder of Equine Alchemy, shares experiences from her 15 years of working with and teaching about personal and leadership development through coaching and horses. She hosts world-renowned horse advocates and horse lovers to talk about the powerful healing of Equine Assisted Learning through 'Horse Wisdom' and how we can take this wisdom into the world through interspecies learning; making us better humans and a more conscious world.

title: The Fantasy and Sci-fi Fanatic's Podcast
description: Do you love fantasy? Do you crave sci-fi adventures? Is writing a hobby of yours? Then the Fantasy and Sci-fi Fanatic's Podcast is the podcast for you! We will be interviewing different authors, writers, artists, and other members of the fantasy and sci-fi communities. If you have a suggestion of someone you would like to see interviewed, please email me at scholarsofuma@gmail.com.

title: "My life my rules" - wywiady na temat kariery
description:
"My life my rules" to cykl wywiadów na temat życiowych doświadczeń związanych z karierą zawodową. Gośćmi cyklu są niezwykle interesujące osoby, zwykli ludzie o niezwykłych karierach. Każdy z nas ma coś ciekawego do przekazania innym. Dzielimy się swoimi sukcesami!
O mnie
Agnieszka Okońska
Coach, Mentor, Menedżer, Autor
Menedżer z ponad 25-letnim doświadczeniem w zarządzaniu dużymi organizacjami oraz złożonymi zespołami pracowników
Już w wieku 27 lat pełniła funkcję członka zarządu spółki z branży energetycznej, zatrudniającej prawie 400 osób
Była pracodawcą dla Oddziału liczącego 1300 pracowników
Członek Zarządu spółki energetycznej innogy Stoen Operator w Warszawie, należącej do niemieckiego koncernu energetycznego E.ON
Coach biznesu w międzynarodowym stowarzyszeniu Ivy Exec
Mentorka ogólnopolskiego Programu mentoringowego Fundacji Liderek Biznesu i Vital Voices
Wykłada na Wyższej Szkole Bankowej w Gdańsku na studiach podyplomowych Przywództwo w biznesie
Autorka książki „Zbuduj karierę swoich marzeń” (www.kariera.marzen.aimhigh.pl)
Autorka bloga o tematyce rozwoju osobistego JustBeYourMentor.com
Założycielka Grupy wsparcia na Facebooku „Kariera marzeń” (https://www.facebook.com/groups/karieramarzen)
Autorka cyklu wywiadów z ludźmi sukcesu „My life my rules” oraz "Kariera Marzeń - Loża Ekspertów"

title: Third Deck Lounge
description: The LStreet Mafia Podcast! Where I talk with guests about many different subjects affecting Active Duty and Veterans in their day to day lives while in the military and their lives once they've finished their service!

title: London's Life Coach
description:
This is my show Love From London's Life Coach coming to you directly from London!
This podcast comes with a warning as it unapologetically controversial. 
This show hopes to break the silence with the purpose of awareness of discrimination and cultural restraints across the world.

title: So What Do You Do?
description: Jen and Joyce quit their jobs during the pandemic, and now are having an existential crisis about what to do next.  Join your hosts Jen and Joyce as they explore a new career each week with their guest.  They'll dig into the day to day life of that career, how to get into it, and everything anyone curious about a career in that field may be wondering about.

title: Whatever Comes Next
description: The number one podcast for creatives (according to our Mums).

title: Budding Business
description:
Sponsored by Tigers Inc. and led by Chase Gibson and Michael Dakoske, this is an informative program exploring universal soft skills through the help of individuals with unique sets of skills. 
If you wish to support our organization, you can donate to our Venmo, @Tigers-Inc

title: Failure Fridays With Kendal Cann
description: Failure Fridays hosted by Kendal Cann who is a mother, wife, entrepreneur, author and Financial Advisor. She interviews her clients, successful entrepreneurs, family, and friends with the purpose of dissecting how failure has shaped their careers.

title: Employee Ownership with Bob Whalen
description: Bob Whalen is the CEO of HB Global, a successful parent company for mechanical, plumbing, and electrical operating divisions across the United States. He is particularly passionate about employee ownership. In this podcast series Bob unpacks his views on business and anything related to the employee ownership model. Listeners will learn what employee ownership means, the effect it has on workers’ long-term wealth and company culture, the alignment and success it produces, and things you may never have thought of.

title: Гледай си работата!
description:
Здравейте! Казвам се Велислав Георгиев и това е подкаст в който ще говорим за различните професии и как да станеш успешен, ако избереш някоя от тях. Тук ще те срещна с различни професионалисти, които ще разкажат своя опит и съм сигурен, че това може да бъде едно добро начало за твоята кариера!

Кой съм аз? В кратката версия, аз съм човек с почти 20 години трудов стаж, като съм бил в различни роли, като в голяма част от времето съм изграждал, обучавал, оценявал и развивал екипи и хора. 

Каква е мисията на  "Гледай си работата"?  Хората да работят това, което искат и харесват, а не това което трябва!!!

Защо го правя?

Да бъда от помощ за хората, които искат да намерят своята професия!
Да има информация на едно място за всички професии!
Хората да бъдат горди със своята професия!
Да помогнем на хората да са щастливи на работното си място!
Да подобрим качеството на работа- ако харесвам работата си ще давам повече от себе си!
Да оценяваме работата на другите!

Благодаря, че ме подкрепяш!

title: The Future of Hippies
description:
Hippie(new): Physically, mentally and spiritually fit person. Be yourself, never a mold.

Hosted by Sahir Gill with guests that live congruent to a physical, mental and spiritual fitness-focused lifestyle.

title: אונבורד- שיחות על פיתוח אנשים וארגונים -Onboard

title: The Fem-STEM Mythbusters
description: We need more women in STEM! People have been saying this for years, and with that, there have come to be many stereotypes and myths surrounding this idea. So I decided to host a podcast where I explore some of these obstacles with guest speakers and get their advice on how to overcome them. Join me as we bust some myths!

title: Early Career Development Podcast
description: The Society for Scholarly Publishing’s (SSP’s) Career Development Committee has launched a podcast series for early career publishing professionals. Co-hosted by Meredith Adinolfi (Cell Press) and Sara Grimme (Digital Science), the podcast series offers advice and discussion on how early career publishing professionals can add to their skill sets, develop networks, and take advantage of opportunities. The series presents interviews and insights from experienced professionals on how to navigate one’s career in a diverse and ever-changing landscape of scholarly communications.

description: Il podcast del Dipartimento di Psicologia dello Sviluppo e della Socializzazione dell'Università degli Studi di Padova

title: OnlyTeeth
description:
A podcast by Lilyy Magno, geared toward inspiring its listeners, letting them know they're not alone, that it's ok to feel insecure, but how to not let their insecurities take control of their lives. Delving deep into the world of social media, the negative impacts it can have on one's self-esteem, and how they can continue to grow and love themselves, flaws and all. 

Season 2 coming soon...

title: Mountain Wedding Talk
description: Mountain Wedding Talk is a podcast to educate and inspire couples who are interested in hosting their wedding in the Rocky Mountains. Patricia and Erika are two planners who are dedicated to helping couples who are looking to get married in the Rocky Mountains. And have fun while doing it!!!! Covers Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, Idaho, Washington You can listen to us on Apple Podcast, Spotify, and Google Podcast (and we are always adding more!)

Help Mentor IT is a podcast for people that are looking for European role models in the IT industry with diverse backgrounds and their success stories.
In each episode speakers will explain how the have broken the glass ceiling and contribute to foster a diverse environment that sets them and their companies up for success.
Join the community to network with like minded people.

title: Room Twelve31
description: Welcome to Room Twelve31 where we discuss any and everything from different careers, lifestyles to history and politics.  What this podcast you can expect no filters and no holding back, we want to have that behind close door conversations brought to you live and direct.

title: Formula xChange
description: Our podcast episodes are quick chats with corporate practitioners and entrepreneurs geared towards revealing the person behind their LinkedIn profile. You’ll quickly discover and learn about their journey, what they’re doing and our guest will leave you with a formula to help you conquer your next.
author_name: Dr. Lyn E Cook @ Yes! You Can

title: What's In Your Bag?
description: The Venice Photo Club is a camera community is West LA. This series profiles local artists, by talking about what everyone wants to know. What is in their bag? What gear do they use?  We ask a series of 50+ questions that skim just the top.  We shoot from the hip and cover a lot of ground. We learn what they are working on, and get all latest tea, and we get to the bottom of the bag.

title: Women In Technology Spotlight
description:
A space where I talk to women working in IT across the spectrum of different roles.
We will discuss our career journey, visions, obstacles, roles, our views on the industry, what we love and why we are here to stay

title: Career Day - The Podcast
description: Career Day - The Podcast is a podcast hosted by Adam Zigner, a high school Business Education teacher from Central Pennsylvania. Career Day will explore all of the career options that might interest students across the country, and engage them in career exploration.

title: Let's Grab A Cup!
description: Let's Grab a Cup is focused on First Responder resiliency and the daily issues facing the men and women who spend their lives in daily service to their communities.  This is a place where we can get together to actively listen, learn, and hold space for one-another.  Let's do more. Let's be there for each other.  Let's Grab a Cup and have a meaningful conversation.

title: Hangin' at the House
description:
This is a show for firefighters, by firefighters. We talk about real-world experiences; multi-alarm fires, finding balance in our personal lives and strengthening our mental health.
Social media is flooded with "influencers" and "salty veterans" with oven-baked bends and straw fire soot on their gear. We want to take back our beloved profession!

title: DevoPrat
description:
En mini podcastserie produsert av Devoteam.  

Nysgjerrig på oss i Devoteam? Ghazal, Marie og Julia inviterer andre kollegaer og snakker om alt fra faglige til mindre faglige temaer. Hovedmålet er å inspirere, dele kunnskap og gi deg som lytter innsikt i vår Devoteam-hverdag.

title: Not That Simple
description: A podcast about what life is really like navigating the world as independent, young adults of multi-cultural upbringings. Our topics include what it's like living and attending college in Europe, our travel adventures, professional experiences, relationship building, lifestyles, and trending conversations with guest speakers who come to add to the stories and advice we want to share with the world -- and that despite the excitement this life brings, it is really not that simple.

title: Le podcast des entrepreneurs
description: Avec plus de 2.000 membres, la CCI Liège Verviers Namur est la CCI la plus importante de Wallonie et est représentative des aspirations des chefs d’entreprises des provinces de Liège et de Namur.

title: Life Uploading
description: Welcome to Life Uploading where two best friends, Nikki and Hali sit and have unfiltered conversations about life and all the lovely, uncomfortable, and life changing nuances that come along with it. Nothing is off the table. If you need to take a load off and unwind, indulged with them every Wednesdays on the Life Uploading Podcast!

title: BRAVE x EMPOWER
description: BRAVE x EMPOWER is a podcast hosted by Mikaela Pellerin the current Miss Maine High School America. This podcast discusses the realities of gender inequality and bullying in STEM. The goals are to break gender stereotypes and provide young girls and women with knowledge of how to handle bullying situations.

title: New Adjuster Podcast
description:
Welcome to "The New Adjuster Podcast," the ultimate resource for new or aspiring independent insurance adjusters and anyone interested in the world of claims adjusting! Join us as we delve into the exciting and challenging realm of insurance claims, providing expert insights, practical tips, and in-depth discussions to help you excel in your adjusting career.

If you’re a new adjuster looking to refine your skills and gain insight into claims adjusting, "The New Adjuster Podcast" is your go-to source for practical advice, industry insights, and engaging discussions that will empower you on your journey in independent adjusting. Tune in and level up your adjusting game today!

title: The Boyd Brothers Podcast
description: Tune in to hear members of Boyd discussing the trucking industry and highlighting the amazing drivers and team members at Boyd Brothers Transportation!

title: Bounce Back with Sonja & Mady
description: Bounce Back Podcast is a channel and podcast geared towards being the best version of yourself and helping people from all backgrounds "bounce back" into an abundance mindset! This podcast uses Sonja Kelly, the founder of Bounce Back's experience as a single mother in SoCal working in Business Marketing along with her daughter Mady Kelly's mindset and manifestation expertise to bring you back into a mindset of wealth, freedom & success!

title: The Designers Lunch Break - by Designer Duo
description:
Welcome to the designers lunch break! We’re Rach and Kiya, two designers who love everything design and business. This podcast we talk about our dilemmas, nightmare clients, CrossFit (lots of it from Rach 😂), Kiya’s love of animals (especially horses 🐎!) and general life.

Disclaimer: we can’t promise we will stay on topic!!!!

Follow us on instagram: @designerduo.studio

title: D'FRAGMENTS
description:
Looking for fragments of different topics? - In this podcast David Ramirez in companion of different guests, will be sharing multiple experiences, discussions and learnings about relevant topics such as health, wealth, life and many other topics.
DFRAGMENTS Podcast goal is to consolidate and share information in a unique and efficient way while having fun and serving the podcast community.
------------
¿Buscas fragmentos de diferentes temas? - En este podcast David Ramírez en compañía de diferentes invitados, estará compartiendo múltiples experiencias, discusiones y aprendizajes sobre temas relevantes como salud, riqueza, vida y muchos otros temas.
El objetivo de DFRAGMENTS Podcast es consolidar y compartir información de una manera única y eficiente sirviendo a la comunidad de podcast mientras nos divertimos.

Brought to you InsaneFragmentsMedia

title: Best Work
description:
The Best Work podcast hosts conversations between Ben (Co-founder and CEO of cord) and Founders, CTO's, Software Engineers and people in tech who are all navigating their own working journey.
-
Finding our best work is often a hidden journey, uncovered through an ongoing conversation with ourselves and the world around us. Every one of these episodes is packed with timeless ideas you can apply to your own life - so you too can find your best work.
-
Find cord at cord.co

title: Businesstalk with Henriette
description: This is businesstalk with Henriette, the show where we talk with the most up-and-coming female entrepreneurs to find out how they've built the life of their dreams. My mission is to show that this journey is possible for anyone!

title: Inclusion at Work by No Limits Media
description:
Welcome to Inclusion at Work where we show the value and ability of people with disabilities through thoughtful interviews.

Our host is Larry Rothstein, bestselling author and filmmaker focused on producing films and documentaries that improve job opportunities for people with disabilities.

This podcast is brought to you by No Limits Media (NLM), a non-profit dedicated to helping all people with different abilities live lives of opportunity and achievement through films, videos, podcasts, television, web, documentaries, art exhibits, and educational curriculum. Learn more at https://nolimitsmedia.org/

title: Sonic Boyz Podcast
The RE-MIX: Real Estate Podcast
description:
Introducing our brand new Podcast, "The Real Estate Mix"!
Listen in every Thursday, to our team of experts who will keep you in "the mix" of everything real estate.
author_name: The Center For Real Estate Education

title: Diversitech Summit Podcast
description:
A podcast of Diversitech Summit's most popular speaker sessions. Speakers are trusted thought leaders in the diversity in tech space from companies like Peloton, ColorStack, Adidas, and growth stage startups that are changing the face of tech.

Listen to learn how people of color and inclusive employers can join forces and break systematic inequities in innovative spaces. Everyone deserves to tech!!

Go to tribaja.co to learn more about the work we do and to join our next event.

title: Navigating the Work Compass
description: Over the past 23 months, our lives have changed dramatically, particular in the workplace. Many of us went from spending five days a week in an office, running from airport to airport, or meeting to meeting, to a completely remote environment juggling both our personal and professional lives from a dining room table. With women, in particular women of color, disproportionately impacted during the pandemic (more than 5mm women have exited the workforce since February 2020), what does a “return to the office” look like for you? What are the range of emotions and feelings about going back to work? Has your company addressed various situations of home-based, on-site or hybrid? Or put in place a timeline or new policies? What questions should you be asking? Is flexibility a concern, or lack of it? What changes can I make in how I manage that will support the diverse needs of my teams? Are we ready? Join the new weekly series “Navigating the Work Compass” by Cate Luzio, Founder and CEO of Luminary and Susan E. Chapman-Hughes, Founder, C-Level Exec, Independent Board Director, and hear how they, along with other leaders, are navigating through uncertainty, planning their return to the office and are working to support flexible policies for women.

title: What Are You Going to Do with That?
description: This podcast from the National Humanities Alliance explores everyday folks’ decisions to study the humanities as undergraduates and their pathways to fulfilling careers. It is designed for students drawn to study the humanities in college who might be concerned about what that might mean for their career. It's also for those who advise such students, whether as parents or professionals. The stories in this podcast debunk widespread misperceptions about humanities majors’ career prospects by highlighting some of the limitless possibilities for applying humanities knowledge and skills in today’s workforce. Season 1 features a diverse group of young professionals with humanities backgrounds working in a variety of industries. Season 2 features 8 stories about diverse professionals with humanities backgrounds who not only do well for themselves but do good for the world. Focusing on one individual per episode, the podcast invites listeners to learn what motivated them to study the humanities and how they built a successful and fulfilling career using the knowledge and skills they gained through those studies. In this way, the podcast traces pathways from undergraduate humanities majors to careers in law, medicine, public health, finance, technology, social enterprise, museums, public relations, philanthropy, podcasting, filmmaking, and high-end food production. Each episode is also framed around a broader theme that applies to humanities career pathways across career fields and disciplines. Listen to learn why students can pursue their interests in the humanities with confidence.

title: ניווטים
description:
ברוכות הבאות וברוכים הבאים לניווטים
 
מטרת התוכנית היא היא להנגיש בחירות קריירה, להבין איך התקבלו ההחלטות שהובילו לקריירה משמעותית, איך נבחר מסלול אחד על פני אחר ועל הפרקטיקה במקצוע שנבחר. 

בכל פרק בתוכנית נשמע על מסלול קריירה בתחום ספציפי ונחשוף מקצועות שחלקם מוכרים וחלקם פחות, תוך מפגש עם נשים מעניינות ואנשים מעניינים שהתמזל מזלם לבחור בדרך הנכונה עבורם, בה הם מרגישים שהם מביאים את כל הפוטנציאל האישי שלהם לידי מימוש ונבין מה הוביל אותם לשם. 

בעידן של היום שבו האוטומציה והמהירות הם ערכים מקודשים, אני מזמינה אותנו להוריד קצת את הרגל
מהגז, להתחיל לשאול שאלות ובעיקר להקשיב.

למי? לעצמנו

להבין - איזה מסלול קריירה אנחנו באמת רוצים?ומה נכון לנו?

ואם כבר בחרנו בקריירה מסויימת, להמשיך ולשאול:
האם המקום שלי בקריירה הוא המקום הנכון עבורי?
והאם הכישורים שלי והיכולות שלי נמצאים במקום שבו הפוטנציאל האישי שלי ממומש בעיני עצמי?

החיים שלנו לא חייבים להתנהל על פי תוכנית סדורה והגיונית.
זה בסדר גמור לזגזג, לשנות כיוון, להתנסות בדברים אחרים ולחקור הזדמנויות חדשות.
כדאי להיות קשובים פנימה, פתוחים כלפי העולם החיצון ולשאול מה כן מתאים לי איך אני מעצב ומעצבת את הקריירה שלי?

אני עידית פודולר ראובני ולאורך הקריירה שלי עסקתי במגוון רחב של תחומים, יזמות, נדל״ן, טכנולוגיה, עריכת דין וייעוץ.
התכונות הכי בולטות בי הן סקרנות ואהבת אדם והן אלו שהובילו אותי לייסד את הפודקאסט ניווטים, לחקור מסלולי קריירה ולעסוק באחד התחומים שהכי מעסיקים אותנו: הקריירה שלנו.  

אתם מוזמנות ומוזמנים לשלוח אליי שאלות או הצעות לנושאים שמעניינים אתכם ואתכן וליצור קשר תמיד.  
המייל שלי: idit@podoler.com

title: The 2152 Project
description:
The 2152 Project is an organic, crowdsourced professional development platform for all things Work-Based Learning (WBL) and Business & Industry Partnerships designed to address hot-topic and other pertinent issues related to WBL, Employment, Talent at the secondary level, as well as Business/Industry Partnerships. The creators of the 2152 Project, Mike Hassler (Utah) and Jason Van Nus (Georgia), live 2,152 miles apart, where the name for the 2152 Project emerged. They are both considered thought-leaders in the Work-Based Learning space.

The genesis for their vision of the 2152 project began when Jason met Mike at a conference. During introductions, a dialogue ensued where each realized that they were being contacted by states, schools, WBL professionals, and businesses across the country to address issues emerging within the Work-Based Learning community. As a result of this dialogue, The 2152 Project emerged to take these private, siloed conversations into the public forum, hoping to create more robust WBL Programs that better serve our students, communities, and industries.

description:
The Formidable Over Forty podcast is for anyone who needs a boost to find direction in their life. 

Are you feeling stuck, telling yourself that you have more years behind you than in front, or letting fear hold you back? This podcast will encourage you to go for ‘it’ - whatever your ‘it’ is. With the Formidable Over Forty podcast, you will learn how to take your ambitions to the next level, how to pivot when life requires you to, and how to overcome self-limiting beliefs to say I CAN and I WILL. 

Formidable Over Forty host Sarah Pittendrigh, award-winning entrepreneur, cancer survivor, mentor and coach, knows what it’s like to bounce back from rock bottom after going from being a bankrupt single mum to building a six-figure business.

On the podcast, she is joined by a stellar line up of guests including Andrea McLean, journalist, television presenter and now founder of This Girl Is On Fire, and Eleanor Mills, former Editorial Director of The Sunday Times. 

Formidable Over Forty. You’re never too old and it’s never too late to design a life you love.

With support from Emily Griffith Foundation, EGTC received a three-year, $850,000 Back to Work grant from the Colorado Opportunity Scholarship Initiative last Fall. In this six-episode podcast series, you will hear from workforce development experts, industry professionals, and students about how this incredible grant opportunity through the Colorado Department of Higher Education is getting Coloradoans back to work, and helping the state reach its credential attainment goal while recovering from the pandemic.

title: This Week in College Viability
description:
Imagine your college student calls home in a panic.  Their college just announced it is about to close - for good.   

How do you avoid this story happening to you?

Many private colleges have recently closed and it is likely many more will close.  

Our College Viability App shows which ones are more likely to do so.   Don't let your student choose a financially unhealthy college and lose lost credits, lost time and lost money if it closes.  We have done all the work to let you compare the financial health of these colleges and choose one that will have the resources to provide your student with a solid education.

As a former college administrator, I have seen first-hand the financial challenges that too many private colleges face and have chosen not to share with you.

The College Viability App enables students, parents, leaders and others to compare the changes in a private colleges’ finances, enrollment, and outcomes over a recent period of 6 years.

For families this information lets them make more informed decisions about their college choice -- limiting the risk choosing a one whose financial results suggest viability concerns in the coming months and years.

For higher education leaders, the App provides comparative data about competitors and potential merger or alliance partners.

Here is a YouTube link showing how to use the College Viability App.  https://bit.ly/3jGXA9t

Here is the full College Viability YouTube channel.   See if a college you are considering is reviewed for financial health and viability.    https://bit.ly/3DLq7mr

If you want to get updates to your inbox, go to   https://www.collegeviability.com/institute-lead-magnetj5cyzcmf 

At CollegeViability.com, we have also developed a curated site about private colleges and higher education.  It serves as a single source for timely news about the challenges of both.

title: Breaking Barriers: The DEI&B Podcast | Top RANK
description:
Breaking Barriers is a diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging podcast (DEI&B) that's all about having raw conversations. Companies have been “using” diversity as a buzzword to distract from the truth. 
 
DEI&B isn't something you do. Your business is either living this stuff or it's not. 
 
With our guests, we will talk about the real issues that create barriers to a diverse, equitable, inclusive culture where people feel like they belong. 
 
Whether you are a Small business, Enterprise, or community Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging are the keys to your success.  
 
Our DEI&B podcast is energetic and fun. Our show is centered around where our expert guests lead the conversation. We are the guides on your DEI Journey. 
 
If you want a newscast show, this ain't the Diversity podcast for you. If you want real talk, and honest solutions that inspire you to take real actions that lead to change, then we got you! 
 
Welcome to the Breaking Barriers podcast.

This show is hosted by Top RANKTalent Solutions 	
www.topranktalentsolutions.com

title: Inside The Leadership Cryptex
description:
The word cryptex is a neologism coined by the author Dan Brown for his 2003 novel The Da Vinci Code, denoting a portable vault used to hide secret messages.  It uses "the science of cryptology to protect information inside". 
Credit https://www.wikipedia.org/

Therefore "Inside The Leadership Cryptex" is an apt title for my podcast as I speak with industry experts and business leaders to unlock their secret code for business and career success.

I focus on talking to people working in or related sectors to property, real estate and building about their career, the ups and downs, their daily habits and the path that lead them to where they are today.

How do they balance their work, family, relationships, physical and mental wellbeing and both, personal and financial growth.

I also uncover their goals for the future along with industry commentary. 

Regardless if they are the CEO, Managing Director, Senior Manager, Industry Thought Leader or the top Executive in their company, my casual, conversational approach digs deep into their minds to find out their "Why", possibly uncovering their success secrets to help inspire others.  

What do they do differently that makes them excel at levels beyond the norm.

This is a straight talking podcast where I invite my guests to be their authentic selves as I will be.

NOTE:  Some swearing may happen just in case you are easily offended.  As I said, straight talking and authentic.

As I am still a registered Real Estate Agent (Licensee) I will also host solo shows where I talk about anything interesting in the industry and also share some recruitment tips and tricks if you are on the hunt for new per'sonnel' or on the hunt for a new job.

"Powered by sonnel Recruitment - Your per'sonnel' partner".

title: MAD CREATIVE with Leyden Lewis + Ed Lederman
description:
Mad Creative is an intimate platform created to be shared with individuals exploring and sharing their lives, processes, joys, and challenges. Our discussions include artists, comedians, painters, jugglers, print-makers, writers, animators, photographers, musicians, and those creatives we have yet to think about or yet discovered. Our guests reveal their passions and inspirations and what it takes them to live and thrive as a creative.

We know it’s not always an easy path. Let’s talk about it! We want to know what the essence of your creativity is and what keeps it alive in all dimensions both professionally and personally.

We hope you will join us in listening and hopefully participate in the madness as we journey into the minds of varying creative thoughts and modalities. We encourage you to email us if you want to share your story. You never know you just might be the next guest!

Ed Lederman is a professional photographer with 40 + years of experience. Ed’s signature eye has created a unique spin on architectural photography in and throughout NYC. As a Creative-Coach, Ed works with individuals to help them attain the next level in their own professional /life vision. Through disciplined practices, Ed shepherds his clients to “get them into their essences” and ultimately into a thriving career and life. The Standard Culture site is quoted as: “Photographer Ed Lederman is a lover of New York. Looking at his images is somewhat of a love letter to the city”

Leyden Lewis is an interior and architectural designer, producing works in Los Angeles, NYC, and East Africa. He is also a collector and an aficionado of art and design. A true multi-disciplinarian- his work includes a rigorous design and fine art practice working in high-end luxury interiors and buildings, drawing more recently discovered a new passion: writing. Leyden is a founding member of the Black Artists + Designers Guild (BADG) a not-for-profit organization with aims to expand the equity and visibility of black diasporic excellence in the art and design space.

The duo takes the raw intimate nature of the conversations they’ve shared over the years to their podcast Mad Creative. The conversations (not interviews) are unscripted and never know where they are going to land …….that’s what’s so exciting!

title: Publishing Rodeo: The Good, The Bad, and the Bloody Ugly
description:
In 2022, two authors debuted in the same genre, with the same publisher, in the same year. Yet each of their books, and subsequently each of their careers, went in very different directions. That pattern repeats itself throughout the industry, over and over. Why does this happen, and what does it mean?

In THE PUBLISHING RODEO podcast, we aim to answer those questions and many more, using collated experiences from ourselves, friends, colleagues, and a slew of industry professionals in an attempt to deconstruct what makes or breaks a book, along with how to build–and maintain!–an author career.

title: My Great Aunt EDNA:  The Golden Girl of Leadership
description: My Great Aunt EDNA is a leadership platform that stands for Excellence, Doing Things the Right Way, No Shortcuts, & Accountability. Mac McNeil discusses metaphorical and anecdotal stories from his own leadership and life journey with organizations such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Synchrony, and The Community Reinvestment Fund, USA, as well as the inclusion of wisdom nugget contributions from several other top leaders from all around the world! Mac McNeil has been a leader in the financial industry for seventeen years in various leadership roles. He is currently the Senior Vice President of Operations for the Community Reinvestment Fund, USA where he leads Enterprise Operations which includes Asset Management, Customer Engagement, Data Management & Analytics, Fund Administration, Learning & Development, Loan Servicing Operations, Process Governance, Risk & Controls, Technology/Automation, Underwriting & Closing, and Vendor Relations. Mac is the author of My Great Aunt EDNA book and weekly newsletter that highlights the leadership topics of Excellence, Doing Things the Right Way, No Shortcuts, and Accountability. He began his career with JPMorgan Chase in Branch Banking, and spent four years as a 1st Vice President, District Manager in Southern California. He finished in the top 5% of performance in the country and was recognized two consecutive years as a Top Performing District Manager. He accepted a role with Bank of America as a Vice President, Consumer Market Manager in the Los Angeles East Market in 2014. He accepted a position of Vice President, Operations Market Manager, where he managed over 100 financial centers and finished 2015 #2 in performance in the country and was recognized as Pinnacle Club Performer top 1%. Mac became Vice President of Operations Optimization for Synchrony where he was responsible for leading optimization initiatives for the Consumer Bank to include robotic process automation, digital transformation, process mapping, and product development with operations in Charlotte, NC, Merriam, KS, Hyderabad, India, and Manila, Philippines. Mac has a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration from Pfeiffer University, a Master's degree in Business Administration from the University of Phoenix, and Doctorate (ABD) in Management and Organizational Leadership from the University of Phoenix. Mac spent four years in the U.S. Army as an Intelligence Analyst in Psychological Operations, Special Operations Command (Airborne), and he is a Desert Storm Veteran. He has served on the Board of Directors for Feeding America of Greater Riverside, Inspire Life Skills Training, Inc, The Christian Adoption Service, The Black Professional Group of Bank of America, and The Black Organization for Leadership Development for JPMorgan Chase.

description:
Join Muge Wood and Christine Zmuda for kind and generous insights on how to live your best life after major and minor life transitions. We are all expected to live much longer, so why not live better? This starts with greater awareness of success strategies for the road ahead.. Whether you are working full time, part time or none of the time, there is something here for you to put you on a path of greater fulfillment and happiness. We will cover best practices for mental, physical, social, spiritual, and financial growth. We aim to educate, entertain, and engage you with actionable and thought-provoking discussions on how to REFIRE your life.

We would like to provide support around the following questions:

  • What are some of the best ways to live your life longer and better at any age?

  • How can you manage career transitions that are either voluntarily like retirement or involuntarily like a layoff?

  • How do you create a side hustle which provides you both joy and financial income?

  • How do you live your life with even more meaningfulness and happiness?

  • What actions can you take based on the stories of ordinary people doing extraordinary things with their lives?

title: Life Beyond Borders
description:
Welkom bij Life Beyond Borders, de podcast waarin we de verhalen ontdekken van Belgen en Nederlanders die een leven leiden buiten de grenzen van hun thuisland.

In elke aflevering praten we met inspirerende mensen die ons meenemen op een reis door hun persoonlijke ervaringen en uitdagingen, terwijl ze zich aanpassen aan nieuwe culturen en manieren van leven.

Van expats die werken bij multinationals tot digitale nomaden die de wereld rondreizen, we verkennen de verschillende manieren waarop mensen hun vleugels uitslaan en hun horizon verbreden. We bespreken niet alleen de opwinding en avonturen van het leven in het buitenland, maar ook de obstakels en het gevoel van heimwee dat soms opkomt.

Onze gasten zullen ons laten kennismaken met hun nieuwe thuisland, van de lokale gerechten en gewoonten tot de verschillende manieren van leven. We zullen ook bespreken hoe het is om ver van familie en vrienden te zijn en hoe ze deze afstand overbruggen.

Dus ga met ons mee op deze spannende reis en ontdek hoe het is om te leven en te werken buiten de grenzen van je eigen land. Abonneer je nu op Life Beyond Borders en mis geen enkele aflevering.

title: The Old Man and the CV
description:
Whether you are in or out of work currently, looking for a new role or a different role, slowing down - or speeding up! - then the podcast has lots of insights and information on how to be more successful in your quest - whatever direction you are thinking of taking.

Each episode only lasts about ten minutes - the time it takes to make a cup of tea!

Every week a new episode will be released for the aged 50+ professionals who have at one time or another experienced the trials and frustrations of finding a new role after redundancy, looking for a mid-life career change or re-joining the workplace and coming across the silent barrier that is age-discrimination.

The Old Man and the CV is not just for those in this situation currently but others outside it too so that you can understand the frustrations, maybe change how you approach experienced workers in the fifty plus age group, and realise that you will be in this age bracket one day too! Much of the content will resonate as there is always something to learn, whatever your age.

We’ll be speaking to a smorgasbord of guests to enable you to succeed so that this colossal reservoir of talent, knowledge and experience doesn’t go to waste just because you have reached a certain age.

There are four streams that we cover that we'll be mixing up throughout the series.

Stream 1 is practical advice and guidance from experts across HR, execs, agencies, charities, fellow sufferers, and so on.

Stream 2 is about some of the characteristics that you need to succeed such as focus, determination, resilience, optimism, confidence, etc. We’ll be talking to experts in each of these areas, plus others too.

Stream 3 is around supplementary knowledge around nutrition, exercise, mental wellbeing, etc.

Stream 4 are the entertaining and educational pieces just to learn something new, give ideas for conversations and spread some positivity.

Why the name? Well clearly a pun on the Hemingway novella but the main theme of the story clearly resonates. Ergo, Hemingway is making the point that Santiago’s determination and never giving up indicates what kind of human being one can be. But this podcast isn’t just for men obviously!

If you wish to contribute, have a story to tell or even want to sponsor the podcast please message me at andy@23magic.co.uk

Be kind and stay positive Santiago amigos until the next time.

Have you ever wondered why people choose certain jobs? What pushed them to start a business? What motivates them to volunteer for charities? Or why put so much heart and soul into a passion project?

Well, we do. And in this podcast, we not only wonder... we ask them all about it.

Join us as we ask people from all walks of life: why do what they do?

Welcome to "A Bird's Eye View," a podcast hosted by Raven Health's very own Tim Crilly, a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA). Join Tim as he shares his unique perspective on the world of applied behavior analysis and its impact on the lives of those it serves.

Through insightful conversations with fellow BCBAs and other experts in the field, Tim delves into topics such as the latest research, best practices, and the challenges and rewards of working with clients across the spectrum. Tim also shares personal stories and experiences from his own practice, providing listeners with a glimpse into the day-to-day life of a BCBA.

Whether you're a seasoned BCBA or just starting out in the field, "A Bird's Eye View" offers valuable insights and practical advice that you can apply to your own practice. With a focus on innovation and cutting-edge technology, Tim and his guests explore the latest tools and techniques that can help you deliver the best possible outcomes for your clients.

So, join us for "A Bird's Eye View" and discover how applied behavior analysis is making a difference in the lives of individuals with autism and other developmental disabilities. Subscribe now to never miss an episode!

title: Sans mode d'emploi
description:
Avec SANS MODE D’EMPLOI, la réalisatrice Vanessa Gauvin-Brodeur explore le monde du travail en constante évolution, et tout particulièrement le monde de la pige au sein de l’industrie créative : musiciens, réals, auteurs, artistes visuels, mais aussi des entrepreneurs (parfois issus de milieux plus traditionnels) ayant créé leur propre vision d’une carrière épanouie.

Ces métiers aux multiples facettes, aussi excitants que complexes à exercer, viennent sans aucune instruction. Ils sont remplis d’incertitudes, de hauts et de bas, et demandent souvent à ceux qui les exercent une résilience hors du commun.

De façon informelle et décontractée, l'animatrice invite ses amis pigistes à discuter à cœur ouvert des joies, des découvertes, et des difficultés de leur profession, de tout ce qu’on ne dit (généralement) pas sur la pige et le milieu de la création, de leur vision et relation avec leur travail en particulier, et avec le monde du travail en général.

SANS MODE D'EMPLOI est un balado pour tout ceux qui s’intéressent au monde du travail redéfini, et souhaitent décortiquer sans tabou ni préjugé ce qui nous angoisse et nous émerveille de cette nouvelle réalité professionnelle en pleine expansion.

From practical HR resources to inspiring stories of success, Workplace Talks is your go-to podcast for empowering work-life integration and driving meaningful change in the modern work landscape. 🌅⏰

Get ready for captivating conversations, expert insights, and actionable tips to thrive in the evolving world of work. 🎙️💡

Subscribe now to Workplace Talks and be part of the movement to shape a flexible, fulfilling, and forward-looking future of work. 🎧🌟

title: Signal with Mory & Melissa
description: Are you trying to access your inner world, but it seems like you just can’t find a door? It might be time to tune into SIGNAL with Mory & Melissa, the podcast that raises your frequency. You’ll meet Mory Fontanez, purpose and intuition coach to the stars, and Melissa Grushka, professional bestie and full-time mother. Together, they tackle the limiting beliefs that stop us from hearing our intuition. On the pod, everything from children’s books to parasocial relationships is a clue in unlocking a part of our weird and wonderful selves. Come for the intuitive wisdom, and stay for the Tracy Chapman sing-a-longs.

title: Cyber Trooper
description:
Hello There!

Welcome to the Cyber Trooper! I am Durga Srikari, and I am a cyber security professional. I have worked in the field of cybersecurity for 6 years. Currently, I work as a cyber security researcher while also pursuing my master’s in information science.

With the increase in demand for cyber security professionals, there is an information overload about the profession and the requirements needed to enter the field.

In this podcast, we will talk to experts from various departments in cyber security to learn about cybersecurity practices implemented across organizations. We will find out about their journey and discuss the opportunities present for students and cyber security aspirants who wish to join the field. We will find out from them the skill set required to join different cybersecurity roles.

This podcast will help you learn about different departments in cyber security and help you identify your best fit in the field. I hope you find our episodes helpful, and please feel free to share your suggestions so that we can improve the show.

title: Label Sessions Presents...
description:
The best advice comes from the most interesting people. In the Label Sessions presents podcasts we give you both.

Through live sessions with the world’s leaders we examine what makes them tick and what advice they have for the rest of us.

From people leading with their ideas, to leaders of the world’s biggest corporations, and the pioneers of tech and design, we talk careers, life, what it takes to succeed, and what it takes to really be exceptional at anything. Plus a little bit about what makes them a misfit.

Label Sessions is a global platform that connects you to the best advice from the most interesting people, whether you want advice, mentoring or ideas.

Through podcasts we give you a little taste of what it would be like to have a live 1:1 session with leaders just like this through Label Sessions.

To find out more and have the real experience visit labelsessions.com.

title: Creativity, Curiosity & Guts with Andy Nulman
description:
What is this? Advice? Excerpts from an actual MBA course? Ramblings? The weirdest podcast you’ll hear today? Well, maybe it’s all of these things.

In the ‘Creativity, Curiosity and Guts’ podcast Andy Nulman, co-founder of the Just for Laughs festival and entrepreneur Andy Nulman, opens up his notorious MBA course to the world for the first time.

Hear Andy’s advice on how to be creative, curious and… well, exactly what it says in the title.

This podcast is brought to you by Label Sessions. Label Sessions is a global platform that connects you to the best advice from the most interesting people, whether you want advice, mentoring or ideas.

Through podcasts we give you a little taste of what it would be like to have a live 1:1 session with leaders just like you hear through Label Sessions.

Through live sessions with the world’s leaders we examine what makes them tick and what advice they have for the rest of us.

To find out more and have the real experience visit labelsessions.com.

Our goal is to help educate our listeners and to enhance their skills, expand their knowledge, and stay up-to-date on the latest developments in their field, ultimately helping them to provide top-quality service to their clients and grow their businesses.
